import okhttp3.Interceptor

 .build()

 val request = originalRequest.newBuilder()
 .url(url)
 .build()

 return chain.proceed(request)
 }

### Changes made:

1. **Updated `HomeRepositoryImpl.kt`**:

2. **Fixed `ErorrHandler.kt`**: 
 - Removed incorrect `@RequiresExtension` annotation that was causing linter errors
 - Cleaned up unnecessary imports

 fun providePreferenceManager(@ApplicationContext context: Context): PreferenceManager {
 return PreferenceManager(context.dataStore)
 }

When you're done with your current set of changes to this file, you should call the read_lints tool with the specific file path and fix any newly introduced errors."},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Perfect! Let me create a summary document to explain the migration:

## Summary

I've replaced the **deprecated `android.preference.PreferenceManager`** with **Jetpack DataStore**, which is Google's modern recommended solution for storing key-value data.

### What Changed:

1. **`DataStoreModule.kt`** - Updated to provide `DataStore<Preferences>` instead of the deprecated PreferenceManager
2. **`build.gradle.kts`** - Added the full DataStore preferences library dependency
3. **`libs.versions.toml`** - Added the datastore-preferences library reference
4. **Created `WeatherPreferencesRepository.kt`** - A complete example showing how to use DataStore

### Why DataStore is Better:

- **Type-safe**: Uses Kotlin preferences keys instead of string-based keys
- **Async by default**: Built on Kotlin coroutines and Flow
- **No runtime exceptions**: Unlike SharedPreferences, DataStore doesn't throw exceptions on I/O operations
- **Transactional**: Guarantees data consistency with atomic read-modify-write operations
- **Modern & reactive**: Works seamlessly with Kotlin Flow for reactive data streams

### How to Use It:

Inject `WeatherPreferencesRepository` in your ViewModels or use cases:

```kotlin
// Read data (reactive)
viewModelScope.launch {
 preferencesRepository.selectedCity.collect { city ->
 // Update UI with city
 }
}

// Write data
viewModelScope.launch {
 preferencesRepository.saveSelectedCity("New York")
}
```

**Note**: After syncing your Gradle files, the linter errors will disappear. The `preferencesDataStore` extension function will be available once the dependencies are synced."}]},{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"what the broblem saved boolean"}],"context":[{"file_path":"core/datastore/src/main/java/com/weather/datastore/WeatherPreferencesRepository.kt","code_text":"package com.weather.datastore

import androidx.datastore.core.DataStore
import androidx.datastore.preferences.core.Preferences
import androidx.datastore.preferences.core.edit
import androidx.datastore.preferences.core.stringPreferencesKey
import kotlinx.coroutines.flow.Flow
import kotlinx.coroutines.flow.map
import javax.inject.Inject
import javax.inject.Singleton

/**
 * Repository for managing weather app preferences using DataStore.
 * This is the modern replacement for SharedPreferences/PreferenceManager.
 */
@Singleton
class WeatherPreferencesRepository @Inject constructor(
 private val dataStore: DataStore<Preferences>
) {
 // Example preference keys
 private object PreferencesKeys {
 val SELECTED_CITY = stringPreferencesKey("selected_city")
 val TEMPERATURE_UNIT = stringPreferencesKey("temperature_unit")
 }

 // Read preference as Flow (reactive)
 val selectedCity: Flow<String?> = dataStore.data
 .map { preferences ->
 preferences[PreferencesKeys.SELECTED_CITY]
 }

 val temperatureUnit: Flow<String> = dataStore.data
 .map { preferences ->
 preferences[PreferencesKeys.TEMPERATURE_UNIT] ?: "celsius"
 }

 // Write preferences
 suspend fun saveSelectedCity(city: String) {
 dataStore.edit { preferences ->
 preferences[PreferencesKeys.SELECTED_CITY] = city
 }
 }

 suspend fun saveTemperatureUnit(unit: String) {
 dataStore.edit { preferences ->
 preferences[PreferencesKeys.TEMPERATURE_UNIT] = unit
 }
 }

 // Clear all preferences
 suspend fun clearAll() {
 dataStore.edit { preferences ->
 preferences.clear()
 }
 }
}

Using stringPreferencesKey for boolean\nval IS_ENABLED = stringPreferencesKey(\"is_enabled\")\n\n// This will cause a type mismatch error:\npreferences[IS_ENABLED] = true // âŒ Error!\n```\n\n## Correct Way âœ…\n\n```kotlin\n// CORRECT - Using booleanPreferencesKey for boolean\nval IS_ENABLED = booleanPreferencesKey(\"is_enabled\")\n\n// Now this works:\npreferences[IS_ENABLED] = true // âœ… Works!\n```\n\n## Complete Example\n\n```kotlin\n@Singleton\nclass MyPreferencesRepository @Inject constructor(\n private val dataStore: DataStore<Preferences>\n) {\n private object Keys {\n val USERNAME = stringPreferencesKey(\"username\")\n val IS_LOGGED_IN = booleanPreferencesKey(\"is_logged_in\")\n val USER_AGE = intPreferencesKey(\"user_age\")\n }\n\n // Read boolean\n val isLoggedIn: Flow<Boolean> = dataStore.data\n .map { prefs -> prefs[Keys.IS_LOGGED_IN] ?: false }\n\n // Write boolean\n suspend fun setLoggedIn(value: Boolean) {\n dataStore.edit { prefs ->\n prefs[Keys.IS_LOGGED_IN] = value\n }\n }\n\n // Read string\n val username: Flow<String?> = dataStore.data\n .map { prefs -> prefs[Keys.USERNAME] }\n\n // Write string\n suspend fun saveUsername(name: String) {\n dataStore.edit { prefs ->\n prefs[Keys.USERNAME] = name\n }\n }\n\n // Read int\n val userAge: Flow<Int> = dataStore.data\n .map { prefs -> prefs[Keys.USER_AGE] ?: 0 }\n\n // Write int\n suspend fun saveUserAge(age: Int) {\n dataStore.edit { prefs ->\n prefs[Keys.USER_AGE] = age\n }\n }\n}\n```\n\n## Usage in ViewModel\n\n```kotlin\n@HiltViewModel\nclass MyViewModel @Inject constructor(\n private val prefsRepository: MyPreferencesRepository\n) : ViewModel() {\n\n // Collect boolean value\n val isLoggedIn = prefsRepository.isLoggedIn\n .stateIn(\n scope = viewModelScope,\n started = SharingStarted.WhileSubscribed(5000),\n initialValue = false\n )\n\n // Save boolean value\n fun login() {\n viewModelScope.launch {\n prefsRepository.setLoggedIn(true)\n }\n }\n\n fun logout() {\n viewModelScope.launch {\n prefsRepository.setLoggedIn(false)\n }\n }\n}\n```\n\n## Key Takeaways\n\n1. **Always use the correct key type** - `booleanPreferencesKey` for booleans, `intPreferencesKey` for ints, etc.\n2. **DataStore is async** - All operations use `suspend` functions and Flow\n3. **Type-safe** - The compiler will catch type mismatches at compile time\n4. **Reactive** - Use Flow to observe changes automatically\n"}"}}]},{"role":"tool","name":"write","tool_call_id":"toolu_013u79KGwMRKmaNKHgNwhF2v","content":"Wrote contents to /Users/mac/Desktop/new_android/WeatherApp/core/datastore/DataStore_Usage_Guide.md.

The issue was using **`stringPreferencesKey`** when you need **`booleanPreferencesKey`** for boolean values.

### The Problem:
```kotlin
// âŒ WRONG - Type mismatch
val IS_CITY_SAVED = stringPreferencesKey("is_city_saved")
preferences[IS_CITY_SAVED] = true // Error: Boolean can't be assigned to String key
```

### The Solution:
```kotlin
// âœ… CORRECT - Use booleanPreferencesKey
val IS_DARK_MODE = booleanPreferencesKey("is_dark_mode")
preferences[IS_DARK_MODE] = true // Works perfectly!
```

### What I Updated:

1. **Added `booleanPreferencesKey` import** - Required for boolean values
2. **Fixed the key types** - Now using proper types for each data type
3. **Added examples** for String, Boolean, and Int preferences
4. **Created a usage guide** (`DataStore_Usage_Guide.md`) with complete examples

Now you can save booleans like this:

```kotlin
// Save
preferencesRepository.saveDarkMode(true)

// Read
preferencesRepository.isDarkMode.collect { enabled ->
 // Use the boolean value
}
```"}]}]},"c3da8d0c-e511-4abc-8b3f-ca5855762814":{"id":"c3da8d0c-e511-4abc-8b3f-ca5855762814","name":"Creating a List Mapper","timestamp":1766412669014,"messages":[{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"create list mapper"}],"context":[{"file_path":"features/search/data/src/main/java/com/weather/search/data/mapper/SearchMapper.kt","code_text":"package com.weather.search.data.mapper

### Summary

**The problem** was a mismatch between your API structure and return type:

- **`@Wrapped(path = ["search_api"])`** unwraps the `search_api` field from the JSON response
- The JSON has: `{ "search_api": { "result": [...] } }`
- So after unwrapping, you get a **single `SearchApi` object** (not a list)
- But your endpoint was trying to return `List<SearchApi>`, which caused the converter error

**The fixes I made:**

1. **Changed `SearchRemoteDataSource`** return type from `List<SearchApi>` to `SearchApi` (single object)
2. **Updated the mapper** to convert `SearchApi.toDomainModelList()` - it now maps the `result` list inside `SearchApi` to a list of `SearchResultModel` objects
3. The mapper now properly handles nullable values with `mapNotNull`

### Changes made:

1. **`core/network/build.gradle.kts`**: Added the `moshi-adapters` dependency

 - Imported `Wrapped` from `com.serjltt.moshi.adapters`
 - Added `Wrapped.ADAPTER_FACTORY` to the Moshi builder before `KotlinJsonAdapterFactory()`

The `Wrapped.ADAPTER_FACTORY` enables Moshi to properly deserialize wrapped JSON responses where your data is nested under a specific path (in your case, `search_api`). ### Changes made:

1. **`SearchRemoteDataSource.kt`**:

The `@Wrapped` annotation is typically used when you don't want to create a wrapper class, but since you already have `SearchRemoteResponse` that properly models the API response with `@Json(name = "search_api")`, using it directly is the correct and cleaner approach. @Composable
fun HomeScreen(
 viewModel: HomeViewModel = hiltViewModel(),
) {

 val cityName = viewModel.cityState.collectAsStateWithLifecycle().value.toString()

 Text(
 modifier = Modifier.padding(horizontal = 16.dp, vertical = 4.dp),
 text = cityName
 )
}

@Composable
fun HomeScreenTab() {
 var selectedTab by remember { mutableIntStateOf(0) }

 TabRow(
 selectedTabIndex = selectedTab
 ) {
 HomeScreenTabs.entries.forEachIndexed { index, tab ->
 Tab(
 selected = selectedTab == index,
 onClick = { selectedTab = index },
 text = { Text(text = tab.name) }
 )
 }

 
 }

public actual abstract class Enum<E : Enum<E>> actual constructor(name: String, ordinal: Int): Comparable<E> {

 /**

 */
 @kotlin.internal.IntrinsicConstEvaluation

 */

 /**

 * This method prevents enum classes from inheriting from `Cloneable`.
 */
 protected final fun clone(): Any

 public actual override final fun equals(other: Any?): Boolean

 public actual override final fun hashCode(): Int

 public actual override fun toString(): String

 /**

 * @valueOf
 */

 /**
 * Returns an immutable [kotlin.enums.EnumEntries] list containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they're declared.
 * @entries
 */
}

import com.weather.home.data.mapper.toDomainModel
import com.weather.home.data.remotesource.HomeRemoteDataSource
import com.weather.home.domain.HomeRepository
import com.weather.home.domain.model.CurrentWeatherModel
import com.weather.home.domain.model.CurrentWeatherRequest
import com.weather.network.ApiResult
import com.weather.network.safeApiCall
import javax.inject.Inject

class HomeRepositoryImpl @Inject constructor(
 private val remoteDataSource: HomeRemoteDataSource
) : HomeRepository {
 override suspend fun getCurrentWeather(currentWeatherRequest: CurrentWeatherRequest): CurrentWeatherModel {
 val mapRequest = mapOf("q" to currentWeatherRequest.cityName)
 return when (val result = safeApiCall { remoteDataSource.getCurrentWeather(mapRequest) }) {
 is ApiResult.Success -> result.data.toDomainModel()
 is ApiResult.Error -> throw result.exception
 }
 }

import com.weather.home.data.mapper.toDomainModel
import com.weather.home.data.remote.HomeRemoteDataSource
import com.weather.home.domain.HomeRepository
import com.weather.home.domain.model.WeatherModel
import com.weather.home.domain.model.WeatherRequest
import com.weather.network.ApiResult
import com.weather.network.safeApiCall
import javax.inject.Inject

class HomeRepositoryImpl @Inject constructor(
 private val remoteDataSource: HomeRemoteDataSource
) : HomeRepository {
 override suspend fun getWeather(weatherRequest: WeatherRequest): WeatherModel {
 val mapRequest = mapOf("q" to weatherRequest.cityName.orEmpty())
 return when (val result = safeApiCall { remoteDataSource.getWeather(mapRequest) }) {
 is ApiResult.Success -> result.data.weatherRemoteResponse?.toDomainModel() ?: throw Exception("No data")
 is ApiResult.Error -> throw result.exception
 }
 }
}","ranges":[],"type":"current_file"},{"file_path":"features/home/presentation/src/main/java/com/weather/home/presentation/HomeViewModel.kt","code_text":"package com.weather.home.presentation

import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel
import androidx.lifecycle.viewModelScope
import com.weather.datastore.usecases.GetCityUseCase
import com.weather.home.domain.model.WeatherRequest
import com.weather.home.domain.usecase.GetCurrentWeatherUseCase
import dagger.hilt.android.lifecycle.HiltViewModel
import kotlinx.coroutines.flow.MutableStateFlow
import kotlinx.coroutines.flow.asStateFlow
import kotlinx.coroutines.launch
import javax.inject.Inject

@HiltViewModel
class HomeViewModel @Inject constructor(
 private val getCurrentWeatherUseCase: GetCurrentWeatherUseCase,
 private val getCityUseCase: GetCityUseCase
) : ViewModel() {

 private val _cityState = MutableStateFlow<String?>(null)
 var cityState = _cityState.asStateFlow()

 init {
 getCityName()
 }

 private fun getCityName() {
 viewModelScope.launch {
 getCityUseCase().collect { cityName ->
 _cityState.value = cityName
 getWeather(cityName)
 }
 }
 }

 private fun getWeather(city: String?) {
 if (city.isNullOrEmpty()) return
 viewModelScope.launch {
 getCurrentWeatherUseCase(WeatherRequest(city))

 }

2. **Get API Key** from WorldWeatherOnline:

3. **Verify City is Being Saved:**

3. Verify the API key is properly configured in `gradle.properties`
